Description of incident: An employee's laptop was stolen from a locked vehicle in June.  It contained billing information about Apria patients in California, Arizona, New Mexico, and Nevada.  Patient names, Social Security numbers, dates of birth, and other personal or health information may have been exposed.UPDATE (09/29/2012): The laptop was stolen on June 14 and was password-protected.  Current and past patients were affected.UPDATE (04/03/2013): Billing information for 65,700 patients was stored on the laptop.
